event.name: RVS_FRONTIER_PRISTINE
event.text: Emerging from your jump, you find yourself in the embrace of a pristine star system, still untouched by the tide of colonists that sweep through this sector. The ethereal beauty of this unspoiled expanse is a fleeting treasure you know won't remain hidden for long. Before you lies a mineral-rich ring, its untouched splendor encircling a majestic gas giant, a sight rarely seen in the reaches of space you traverse but one that tempts you to spoil it.

choice.text: (Beam Drones) Attempt to harvest the ring.

event.text: Giving into the temptation, you navigate your ship into the mineral-rich ring encircling the gas giant. As your vessel penetrates the shimmering veil, the brilliant particles come alive in a mesmerizing ballet. Mining drones hum to life, diligently extracting the valuable resources that have remained untouched until now. Each haul underscores the untouched grandeur of this system, yet as your ship departs, laden with riches, you can't shake the feeling that your actions have irreversibly shifted the balance of this pristine sanctuary.

Opting to momentarily set aside the allure of riches, you choose instead to focus on your ship's upkeep. Against the backdrop of the mineral-rich ring's beauty, you take a moment to appreciate the untouched serenity of the cosmos. The interplay of particles becomes a soothing reminder of the universe's majesty, offering a respite from the clamor of ambition as our FTL drive hums in the background as it charges.

Amid the satisfaction of your successful harvest, fate takes an abrupt turn. The ship becomes ensnared within the ring's embrace, and asteroids awaken to pummel against the hull. Your ship is unscathed just yet, but urgency fills the air as your crew fights to charge their FTL drive to get out before the universe decides to punish us any further.

With a determined resolve, you steer your ship into the heart of the mineral-rich ring encircling the gas giant. The glittering particles come alive as your vessel passes through them, a breathtaking cosmic display. Your crew works tirelessly, manually extracting the valuable resources that have remained untouched until now. As your ship departs the ring, laden with riches, a sense of reverence mingles with the weight of responsibility. It's clear that your presence has initiated a transformation of this once-undisturbed haven.

event.name: RVS_FRONTIER_MIXED_SETTLEMENTS
event.text:
Emerging from your jump, you find yourself amidst a remarkable tableau. A lush planet stretches before you, transformed into a testament of unity. Alien races, once estranged, now work together, their ships repurposed into temporary shelters and structures within their budding settlements. Various alien races such as the Orchids, Rockmen, Aquarians, Slugs, and Humans have gathered here and call this land their home, a rare and heartening sight in a universe often marked by strife.
You are left to wonder if it is a fleeting collaboration or perhaps it may hold the answers to a more peaceful universe. The latter may hold some merit, as the settlers have offered an invitation to land and join them for some freshly made pastries and a small helping of left over scrap materials from their ships' conversions.

event.name: RVS_STORE_FRONTIER_NEUTRAL_ENFORCED
event.text: The space station here is of extraordinary size, a marvel of engineering. It appears to function as a permanent orbital habitat. You consider docking here for some well-deserved respite and to browse the stores. However, you catch the familiar orange hue of a Rebel ship comes into view, already docked at the station. An automated transmission interrupts your thoughts: "You have entered a no-fire zone. Weapon discharge will not be tolerated." It seems that you shouldn't find any trouble here, yet the prospect of sharing the same space with a Rebel ship leaves you feeling conflicted.

choice.text: Dock at the station to trade and ignore the Rebel.

event.text: You secure your ship at the station, situated adjacent to a bustling trade depot. You commence your inspection of the array of valuable technologies on offer for purchase.
You decide to pass on docking at the station and decide to do something else.

event.name: RVS_STORE_FRONTIER_ATTACK_REBEL
event.text: Defiant in the face of warnings, you refuse to abide the presence of the Rebel ship and launch an assault, eliciting shock from both the Rebel crew and the surrounding civilians. As anticipated, the station's ASB battery springs to life in retaliation, its weaponry converging on your vessel. To make matters worse, an automated message further aggravates the situation by listing an ongoing tally of your past and present infractions.

event.name: RVS_STORE_FRONTIER_ATTACK_ENGINEER
event.text: Defiant in the face of warnings, you refuse to abide the presence of the Rebel ship and launch an assault, eliciting shock from both the Rebel crew and the surrounding civilians. As anticipated, the station's ASB battery springs to life in retaliation, its weaponry converging on your vessel. To make matters worse, an automated message further aggravates the situation by listing an ongoing tally of your past and present infractions.

event.name: RVS_STORE_FRONTIER_ATTACK_TURNCOAT
event.text: Defiant in the face of warnings, you refuse to abide the presence of the Rebel ship and launch an assault, eliciting shock from both the Rebel crew and the surrounding civilians. As anticipated, the station's ASB battery springs to life in retaliation, its weaponry converging on your vessel. To make matters worse, an automated message further aggravates the situation by listing an ongoing tally of your past and present infractions.

event.name: RVS_STORE_FRONTIER_ATTACK_GUARD
event.text: Despite the warnings, you attempt to engage the Rebel ship presuming the station would turn a blind eye to your transgression. Yet, to your surprise the station's guards swiftly spring to action and move in to intercept you! Granting the Rebel ship the opportunity to undock and escape, leaving you in the clutches of the station's guards.

event.name: RVS_FRONTIER_SCRAPYARD
event.text: It hadn't been long when this sector first began to be colonized but even in such little time, signs of pollution have already marred the planetoids surface below.Large wrecking yards billowing smoke. Although the planetoid isn't fully inhabited, watchtowers and cranes have been erected to oversee and coordinate the reclamation of scrap materials, destined for use in constructing stations and settlements across the system.

choice.text: Stay in orbit to gather some debris.

event.text: Opting to stay in orbit, directing your ship to carefully gather scattered debris left adrift in orbit. Sifting through the remnants, salvaging various materials and valuable components. It's evident that these fragments once belonged to spacefaring vessels discarded during the early stages of colonization. Your efforts yield a modest but worthwhile haul of resources, providing a small but meaningful boost to your ship's supplies.

Utilizing your ship's improved sensor array. It becomes easier to detect where the more dense wreckage from an old Colony Ship that was likely stripped and abandoned upon arriving to this sector. Though mostly already gutted she still has some valuable resources left to be claimed.

choice.text: Head down into the wrecking yard.

event.text: You would rather not commit the time to go comb through someones refuse.

event.name: RVS_FRONTIER_SCRAPYARD_FEE
event.text: You are hailed by a Zolan who is the acting warden of this facility. After you state your intentions they allow you to continue your approach if you pay an enterance fee and submit yourself through processing at their local office not far from the visitors landing pad.
You weren't prepared to pay an entrance fee and decide to remain in orbit instead.

event.name: RVS_FRONTIER_SCRAPYARD_FEE_FUEL
event.text: Embedded within the debris lies the battered remnants of a Fermi-class Fuel Tanker, a rarity outside the Ministry space and the Federation Logistics Force. Renowned for its ability to safeguard volatile fuel with its powerful shields, the wreck reveals a trove of well-preserved fuel cells stored within. Allowing you to collect as much fuel can manage before the Rebel Fleet advances any closer.

event.name: RVS_FRONTIER_SCRAPYARD_FEE_SCRAP
event.text: As you explore the remnants of a once-mighty Zoltan Agricultural Ship, its hydroponics and systems stripped bare, you stumble upon an Engi Shipbreaker amidst the mechanical wreckage. Engaging them in conversation, they explain that Engi, renowned for their technical prowess, often grapple with the challenges of planetary gravity, favoring the efficiency of zero-g environments. Grateful for the interaction, the Engi directs your attention toward a valuable cache of machinery, fulfilling your desire for scrap materials.

event.name: RVS_FRONTIER_SCRAPYARD_FEE_DUD
event.text: Through the sprawling wrecking yard you came to discover that it has already been thoroughly picked clean by automated salvage operations. A testament to the remarkable ability of the Engi to clean through the wreckage as efficiently as they do. Taking what little useful materials that were left behind.

event.name: RVS_FRONTIER_SHRINEWORLD
event.text: The world below stands transformed into a Cathedral World, a luminous testament to the Rockmen's faith and stonemasonry. Yet, there's no time to fully appreciate the sight. A theocracy ship emerges from the atmosphere, intent on intercepting you. Their reception isn't warm; alien vessels orbiting their sacred ground raise concerns which are met with extreme prejudice.
The Theocracy ship hurtles toward you with unwavering determination, poised to expel you from this beacon.

The Rockmen hold deep reverence for the Zoltan. The ship hesitates, thrown off by the monks' earnest plea. "Perhaps we have erred in our judgment, alien. Your words ring with wisdom, and we are willing to pardon your transgression, even though you do not share our faith. Accept these alms as a symbol of our forgiveness."

event.name: RVS_FRONTIER_NEBULA_COLONY_DEAD
event.text: Swirling nebula clouds obscure your view, compounded without inoperable sensors adds to the difficulty of seeing anything. Tiny debris sparks off your hull giving hint that there is something inside the nebula. Cracks in the clouds reveal a battered abandoned installation before you.
You are uncertain what may lay beyond into the clouds and decide to stay put while your FTL drive charges instead.

event.name: RVS_FRONTIER_NEBULA_COLONY_GAS_MINE
event.text: Clouds swirling past as you make your approach to the structure. The frequency of the sparks escalated as you came closer to the site. Through the parting in the nebula in clear view is an installation that is identified as a Class-C Gas Extraction and Processing Facility that was abandoned some time after completion for reasons unknown. There is potential scrap and leftover cargo offer an opportunity for salvage which you're not willing to let go to waste.

event.name: RVS_FRONTIER_NEBULA_COLONY_SCIENCE
event.text: As you draw nearer to the installation, the sparks grow more frequent. Almost mesmerizing, the beauty of the dancing lights reflects off the glass as you reach the site. It becomes evident that this was once a deep space research facility, now marked by ion storm damage. Abandoned for a considerable time, it offers a rich bounty of scrap and equipment waiting to be claimed.
It would be disrespectful to salvage this vessel so you choose to do something else.

textList.name: RVS_TEXT_DISTRESS_FRONTIER_EMPTY_SHIP
textList.text: You arrive to find a ship floating among some debris. Your hails go unanswered and it isn't surprising why. The vessel drifts in eerie solitude, crewless and adrift in the expanse of the frontier.
Upon your arrival you find the source of the distress signal, a drifting hulk that has since long been abandoned... You are left to your imagination as to what may have happened to their crew.

Responding to the distress signal you spot what appears to be the source. Floating motionlessly your scans indicate that every airlock has been left open. Potentially the results of an electronic attack or a very unfortunate series of events following a fire. Once full of life the ship now drifts through the endless expanse.

You receive a patchy transmission immediately on arrival "Mayday, Ma-**-ay, Mayday! We have run out of fuel and are awaiting immediate assistance!... We encountered a ******* ***** ****** *-nd **** ** ***... we're running low o-* rations and we do-** **** much ti-** left... **** starved out just over a week ago... Please if you can hear this please resp-***!" You rush to aid the survivors but to your dismay the ship shows on scans completely empty on closer inspection. You're listening to a pre-recorded message which only continues to get more and more laden with static until it abruptly stops as the ship's backup generator dies... you are left wondering what had happened here.

Rushing to aid the distressed vessel, you assess its plight - their fuel reserves are empty and their reactor has gone cold leaving the ship to be left adrift for a long time now. Despite your best analysis you can not deduce the eventual fate of the crew or their current whereabouts.

event.name: RVS_DISTRESS_EMPTY_SALVAGE_RESOURCE
event.text: While there is no hope to save them, you opt to salvage what you can from their empty vessel. With the resources you have scoured from the vessel you come to a realization that these materials may help you in your journey, but also a silent echo of the crew's fate as a lingering reminder of the dangers out in the great expanse.

event.name: RVS_DISTRESS_EMPTY_SALVAGE_MAP
event.text: You choose to salvage the vessel, recovering what little remains of their once-living ship. You find a small silver lining as their navigation computer is fully intact. Your technicians get to work recovering their sector scans to update your map with. You find it disturbing to find that their flight path almost matches your current one perfectly albeit a few weeks prior.

event.name: RVS_DISTRESS_EMPTY_SALVAGE_WEAPON
event.text: With a salvage operation underway your crew comb through the hulk. No clues as to what may have happened to the crew here. Yet, amid the desolation, a fortunate discovery awaits - a fully operational weapon nestled within their cargo hold!

event.name: RVS_DISTRESS_EMPTY_SALVAGE_SICK
event.text: You choose to salvage the vessel, recovering what little remains of their once-living ship. With your team coming back aboard one of them begins to lose their balance and collapse with a severe cough. With them being rushed out from the airlock to receive medical attention they begin to recover and recompose themselves. Personnel scans indicated that they had only suffered from mild nausea while boarding the vessel. With no risks to infection you release them from quarantine but it does leave you wondering what happened to the ship's original inhabitants...
You give them the fuel.

choice.text: (Fuel Conserver) Show them how to wire up their own conserver.

event.text: You break out the manual for your conservation device and give it to the Civilians. Whatever they throw together won't be nearly as efficient, but it should get them somewhere.

choice.text: Apologize, wish them luck, and continue on.

event.text: "Understandable... Have a nice day, and do send anyone you reckon is trustworthy our way."
A helpless ship is an easy target. You move in on an attack vector and engage!

textList.name: RVS_TEXT_DISTRESS_FRONTIER_FUEL
textList.text: "Ahoy there! What a sight for sore eyes you are! Our fuel reserves have run dry, and we've been stranded in this desolate sector for what feels like an eternity. The constant dread of pirate raids or the looming presence of those Rebel troublemakers has kept us on edge. Would you be willing to spare some precious fuel to aid us?"

"Hey there. We used up the last of our FTL fuel to make a jump to this colony, aiming to find sanctuary in the midst of this uncharted frontier, but, well... it seems we misjudged the distance by a mere jump. Now, stranded in this sector, we've been wrestling with the consequences ever since as we count the days go by."

A lone spacecraft drifts far from the beacon, fragments of broken meteoroids around it. A transmission crackles to life: "Greetings. Our hunt for ore-rich asteroids in this uncharted sector had been a lot more draining than we expected, after suffering a missjump we've been stranded since."
The ship emitting the distress beacon messages you, "Sorry to bother you, but we're out of fuel and can't get out of this uncharted sector. Could you help us out?
A small civilian ship flies over as soon as you arrive. You're prepared to fight but they just inform you that they're out of FTL fuel and can't jump.

Deep in the frontier, a survey vessel drifts, its engines dormant. A weak signal breaks the silence: "Tasked with mapping these stars, oh so many stars there are... stars stars stars..., we misjudged our fuel oh we did yes we did. Stranded far from the closest station or civilization!, our engines are silent. Can you assist?"

textList.name: RVS_TEXT_HAZARD_VAMPWEED_FRONTIER
textList.text: As your ship hovers dangerously close to a blazing star, the searing heat tests your vessel's integrity. Suddenly, a Vampweed ship emerges from behind the star's corona, launching a daring attack. Desperate to escape this beacon, the Vampweeds board your ship attempting to take control of the vessel!

The Class-K star scorches your ships' paint upon arrival. The beacon has been unknowingly placed too close to the sun by the automated expeditionary vessels that charted this sector. Sharing this isolated space with you is a desperate and withered Vampweede vessel. Driven by desperation, they launch an aggressive boarding attempt, seeking to seize your ship by force!

textList.name: RVS_TEXT_ENCOUNTER_ROCK_FRONTIER
textList.text: A lone rock vessel is lost in the distant stars far from their colonies. Instead of turning to you for salvation, they've decided to take their frustration out on you.

Sensors indicate a single Rock vessel holding in an attack stance broadcasting to you on open channels. "The Gods have blessed me with the beauty of this sector and I won't let you spread the Federations blight here. Perish!"

A rock ship has taken a journey through this sector on a pilgramage in search of their place in the universe. Your attempts to hail them interrupts their meditation. Taking offense at your act, they arm their weapons!

The Rockmen are hardy people: What may look like a completely uninhabitable planet below is actually in the process of having a colony established. However, a Rock patrol ship protecting the colony considers you a pirate and decides to ward you off with extreme prejudice.
The Theocracy often takes no chances with outsiders and this is even more so evident out in the frontier. They arm their weapons and you follow in kind.
"Outsider! These lands are claimed by the Theocracy! You have insulted us with your presence, prepare to die!" A fight is unavoidable.
You encounter a Rock vessel and attempt to open trading frequencies, but they take it as an act of cultural transgression and open fire.

It looks quiet, but you realize your computer is being scanned. A hidden Rock vessel hails you: "Why do you fill your computer with lies?! These are not the holy words!" Before you can interject they open fire.
You notice a Rock ship performing combat exercises. However, they quickly change their course to engage your ship. They apparently treat unregistered alien ships as handy target practice.

textList.name: RVS_TEXT_ENCOUNTER_AUTO_FRONTIER
textList.text: It comes to no surprise to find an automated forward scout of the Rebel fleet so far out lurking amongst the stars. A fight is unavoidable.
You have arrived at an uninhabited system with no signs of colonization, except for a Rebel Autonomous scout exploring this beacon and they do not seem willing to share their discoveries with you.

Sensor readings reveal the remains of an ill-fated Union Carryship, once brimming with hopeful colonists, now a lifeless derelict adrift in this beacon's vicinity. As you cautiously draw nearer to investigate, a Rebel Automated ship abruptly emerges from the wreckage, swiftly transitioning from its hiding place to a predatory stance, ready to seize its next victim.
One of the Rebels unmanned scout ships has been spotted patrolling around the frontier. Its AI considers you a significant threat! A fight is unavoidable.

Emerging from your FTL jump, you find yourself in a mesmerizing binary star system. The view is breathtaking, yet amidst the celestial spectacle, a lone Rebel forward automated scout lurks nearby, a grim omen of an imminent clash that cannot be avoided.

The Rebel Engineers have been busy in this sector to help pave the way for the Rebellions expansion. Thus, it's hardly astonishing to encounter one alongside its automated guardian, which promptly changes course to intercept you, while the engineering vessel hastily jumps away at the slightest hint of trouble.
You discover a nearby planet speckled with settlements, although none respond to your hails and you come to realize why; as an automated Rebel Ship comes speeding towards you..

You discover a nearby planet speckled with settlements, one of them hails you. "Caution! The Rebels have claimed this system. It isn't safe for-" the transmissions begins to break up. A Rebel Automated ship seems to be the source of the disruption and now it locks onto you and begins its assault.
A Rebel autonomous scout is exploring this beacon. You attempt to hide behind a nearby moon, but the ship finds you and begins its assault.
The AI of a nearby small Rebel scout immediately identifies you as a threat and engages.

textList.name: RVS_TEXT_ENCOUNTER_REBEL_FRONTIER
textList.text: You are taken aback by the beauty of a nearby eclipse glowing radiantly from a nearby planetoid. You would have considered this a fortuitous moment to arrive just in time to witness such an event; if not for the familiar sounds of a Rebel ship hailing to state their intentions of eliminating you once and for all.

This system is relatively undocumented and to your surprise, your ships sensors have detected various belts and moons rich and abundant of natural resources to any prospective frontiersmen that would be interested in settling in these parts... even more surprisingly your sensors have detected a Rebel ship that doesn't wish to share with you this systems discovery.

Its uncommon to see manned Rebel ships this far out from any nearby fleet elements especially in neutral sectors such as these. You receive a transmission: "It's you! Surrender to the talons of the Rebellion or face our wrath!"
A defiant Rebel hail disrupts the harmonious backdrop, declaring, 'Our war won't end until we've shattered your Federation dreams!' Weapons lock on and going hot.
A Rebel ship contacts you near the emerging colonies, promising a 'safer world' for the frontier. Though they must have a different idea of what safe means as their weapons arm.
A Rebel fighter's boastful hail is silenced as you prepare to engage in combat, cutting off their rhetoric against the sector's calm.
In this sector of astronomic wonders, your arrival and a Rebel ship's coincide, leaving no choice but to clash amidst the untouched expanse.
A Rebel ship's boastful hail is silenced as you prepare to engage in combat, cutting off their rhetoric against the sector's calm, introducing discord to the once untouched expanse.

You have emerged to what appears to be a Rebel FOB being constructed on a nearby moon and they appear to have made us out! A Rebel ship breaks off from guarding the Riggers setting the base up and moves in to engage.

You have arrived at this beacon and began going through your checklists before making for the next jump while the drive charges. But unbeknownst to you it seems a fledgling colony below does not fancy your arrival and has sent for a Rebel ship to expedite your departure.
It isn't a surprise that the Rebels have also shown interest in this sector, even more so attemtping to protect their claims here by attacking you on sight!
Caught off guard by a Rebel ship near the burgeoning colonies, A confrontation is unavoidable with the mute ship refusing hails and entering an attack vector.
A Rebel ship has been patrolling this region collecting 'tariffs' on the nearby colonists. But as soon as you arrive it begins its assault.
You receive a transmission: "Sorry sir, this is nothing personal but we're under orders." The Rebel ship's weapons go hot.
A Rebel ship hails. "We did not fight a war to let a single Federation ship shatter our dreams of a better galaxy!" He locks weapons.
You're hailed by a Rebel ship: "When the rebellion is complete you'll see the safer world we provide. Well, you won't, but you get the point." They arm weapons.
Your arrival coincides almost exactly with that of a Rebel ship. It's hard to know who is more surprised, but there is no option but to fight.
